name: More Bogart Quiz | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: Bogart starred with Bacall in "Key Largo", but it was a different actress who had the juicier role in the movie. Who was she?
questions.explanation:
Claire Trevor.

	Along with her role in "Stagecoach", this may be her best-known role.

questions.text: The always solid Ward Bond appeared in "Maltese Falcon". In what role?
questions.explanation:
Cop.

	Bond is one of the cops who investigates the death of Bogart's partner. He's a minister in John Wayne's "The Searchers" and a bus driver in the Clark Gable and Claudette Colbert movie "It Happened One Night". Always a very good supporting actor.

questions.text: Bogart tries to kill second wife Barbara Stanwyck in "The Two Mrs. Carrolls". How?
questions.explanation:
Poison.

	Evil - or crazy? In any case, he's scheming to dump Babs. Not bad.

questions.text: Bogart plays a hoodlum in "The Petrified Forest". Who plays the female lead?
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	With Leslie Howard. Important early role for Bogart.

questions.text: What is the treasure of the Sierra Madre mountains?
questions.explanation:
Gold.

	Poor, crazy Fred C. Dobbs. A classic.

questions.text: Bogart's unkind nickname is "Old Yellow Stain" in what movie?
questions.explanation:
The Caine Mutiny.

	From the excellent Herman Wouk novel. Fine movie with Fred MacMurray, Van Johnson, E.G. Marshall and José Ferrer. One of Bogart's best roles.

questions.text: Who does Bogart shoot in "The Big Sleep"?
questions.explanation:
Canino.

	Canino is the sadistic hood at the end of the movie. Always interesting to see Bogart as a private eye - but this is one tough plot to follow.

questions.text: Which is NOT a movie that includes Bogart in the cast?
questions.explanation:
All The Brothers Were Valiant.

	"Victory" is a classic Bette Davis movie; Bogart has a small supporting role. "Night" pairs Bogart with George Raft. "Lonely Place" is a so-so Bogart movie. "Valiant" is a Robert Taylor/Stewart Granger movie.

questions.text: Bogart appears with Bacall (and Walter Brennan) in "To Have and Have Not". Who has a supporting role as the piano player?
questions.explanation:
Hoagy Carmichael.

	Nice turn by Hoagy. Wilson is the piano player (and singer) in "Casablanca". Mitchell is the piano player in the well-done Doris Day and James Cagney movie "Love Me or Leave Me".

questions.text: Where did Bogart hide the letters of transit in "Casablanca"?
questions.explanation:
The piano.

	The best place to hide something is often in a conspicuous place. What can you say about one of the all-time great movies?
